string.text: Your guys on the Barrier say that you're looking for someone reliable...

My men have almost finished digging a tunnel to the Dark Valley, but to complete it we need a few sticks of dynamite. I saw some in the Cordon rookie camp recently. Can you get go and it for us? You'll be rewarded...
Okay, I'll have a look around when I'm at Cordon next
Sorry, I've other things to do
Hey! Here's your dynamite!
Wow! Let's see!

You've no idea what it's like carrying this stuff. I've been afraid to run, or drop my rucksack, or get too close to any anomaly! I'm glad to be rid of it, that's for sure. I just hope it was worth it...
Thank you. Here's what we're planning. It should come out near the lake in the Dark Valley. If you ever need to use it, feel free. Just keep it a secret, okay?
Thanks, and I promise...
Hi, Marked One. We've been waiting for you, and the dynamite...
Yes. Sorry about the delay. I needed to be careful with it...
Well, now the guys'll blow up the final part, and then Freedom will be free to travel freely. It will for your use too, friend
Wow, well done. I'm impressed
The information on Ghost mentioned something about an unmarked road

You've a sharp eye. But you know the old saying, you don't get anything of value for nothing? We've been experimenting with a few rare artefacts. One in particular has been impossible to acquire, the 'Elder Beads'. Have you heard of it? Bring one to me, and I'll show you the trail
I'll try to find one for you
I need to go to the Monolith, so I don't have time right now
Here, I brought you an Elder Beads
You've got to be kidding me. Let me see it!
Here, it's yours...

Amazing! Simply amazing! Okay, here's the trail. I'll mark it on your map, from Agroprom leading straight here. See?\nHowever, I don't know the way back. There's evidence that the Military at Agroprom have documents that show the location of the road. But the case with those documents has gone missing. Do you think you could find them for us?
Are these documents still around Agroprom?
They're definitely not in the Military Base. We've looked. But they can't be far from it, either
I'll find them for you, don't worry
No, I need to make my way to the Monolith
That's great news! I'll await your return
Well, there'll still be time. Come back as soon as you can
I brought you the documents
Let's see what you have
Here, take a look
Yes, exactly what we were looking for. They give the location of the path from here to Agroprom
Thank you, Professor!
Mongol
Core
Hi, do you do repairs?
Yes, but it's not cheap. It's very difficult to get decent spares here. The more wear, the more expensive it will be. What would you like done?\n.\nList of repairs possible:
Would you repair my sidearm, please?
Would you repair my primary weapon, please?
Would you repair my armor, please?
Sorry, I'm short of cash at the moment. I'll come back later
Just give me a moment...\n.\nThere you go. All yours!
Oh, Marked One... it's good you called... I have your armor around here somewhere... (Damn, where is it?) Yes, here it is! There you go! Like new!
Let's see. Hey, good work! I won't insult you by asking how you fixed it, but I respect your skills. Thank you...
Excellent work, and well worth the money!
Can you fix something else for me, please?
Sure, no problem\n.\nHere's my price list:
Lanky
Associate
Loner

Ammunition -
: 7.62x54mm
Capacity -
: 100 rounds
.
This extremely rare weapon is found only in heavily armed detachments of Military Stalkers. Because of its large size and weight, it requires the use of Exoskeleton armor, to which it must be physically attached.
The original PK Pulemyot Kalashnikova or 'Kalashnikov's Machinegun' was a development of Kalashnikov's automatic rifle design, firing the 7.62x54mmR Eastern Bloc standard ammunition originally from the Mosin-Nagant.
It is equipped with a simple bipod, and designed as a squad-level support weapon. It is also suitable for fixed installation and vehicle mounting, and can be used as a light anti-aircraft weapon when fixed to an AA mount.
Most are belt-fed, using linked 25-round belts, which can be joined together to create any length necessary. Typical of Soviet machine guns, the standard model feeds from the right, and expels its spent cases via an ejection port on the left side of the weapon, contrary to the RH side ejection port on most Western machine guns.
The current model is the PKM Kalashnikov's Machinegun Modernized, an improved version of the PK and weighing only 7.5kg when empty
PKM Pulemyot Kalashnikova

Regular sniper cartridge for the SVD rifle, SVU-AS rifle, and the PKM machine gun. Available in 100 or 250 round belts for the manual version of the PKM machine gun.\nDespite the fact that the 7N1 cartridge was adopted in 1967, it is 2-3 times less accurate than the 7N13 in terms of dispersion. Also, due to the cold stamped steel core, the shell does not fragment on penetration, thus causing less internal damage

Ammunition: 5.7x28mm FN SS190\n.\nThe FN P90 is a selective-fire PDW (personal defense weapon) designed and manufactured by FN Herstal in Belgium. The P90's name is an abbreviation of FN's Project 9.0, in response to NATO requests to replace standard 9x19mm Parabellum firearms. It was designed as a compact but powerful weapon for vehicle drivers, operators of crew-served weapons, support personnel, special forces and counter-terrorist groups. The P90 has a futuristic appearance, featuring a compact bullpup design and ambidextrous controls, and incorporates several innovations - such as the top-mounted magazine and FN's high velocity 5.7x28mm ammunition. Originally developed between 1986 and 1990, a P90 TR variant was introduced in 1999, featuring a triple rail interface system for mounting accessories. Since 2005, the P90 has been offered to civilians as the PS90, a semi-automatic sporting model with a longer barrel
FN P90
Ensign Sherstuk
Repair kit for field repairs of body armor and other vital equipment
Remnabor RIA
Repair kit for field repairs of weapons
Remnabor RIW
Box for repair kits
Toolbox
Saiga 12C

Saiga-12C automatic shotgun. Reliable and accurate, it is used as an assault weapon for close combat operations. Automatic reloading is made possible by feeding combustion gases from the barrel bore through the barrel port. An optional sight leaf, adjustable for windage and elevation, makes zeroing and firing at moving targets more convenient.
Ammunition:
12x70 buckshot,
12x76 slug,
12x76 dart

Kalashnikov model 1947, chambered for 7.62x39mm ammunition. A simple, reliable and ubiquitous weapon, although the low cost of its production process affected its overall useability and accuracy. Not often seen in the Zone because of its lack in service in the Military.
Ammunition:
7.62x39mm fmj
7.62x39mm AP
PDA
PDA
MIL PDA
MIL PDA

A personal digital assistant (PDA), also known as a palmtop computer, is a mobile device that functions as a personal information manager. It has an electronic visual display, enabling it to include a web browser, but newer models also have audio capabilities, enabling them to be used as mobile phones or portable media players. Many can access the Internet, intranets or extranets via Wi-Fi or Wide Area Networks

A more rugged, military specified version of a consumer personal digital assistant (PDA), also known as a palmtop computer - a mobile device that functions as a personal information manager. It has an electronic visual display, enabling it to include a web browser, but some models also have audio capabilities, enabling them to be used as mobile phones or portable media players. Many can access the Internet, intranets or extranets via Wi-Fi or Wide Area Networks. Military PDAs are sought after items amongst tech-savvy Stalkers, because they usually contain more accurate, updated and restricted info on the Zone, plus the movements of military personnel and other 'persons of interest' inside it
Super Gauss canister

Gauss pistol, a single-handed weapon comprising a high energy capacitor feeding a series of convergence elements, creating an enormously focused destructive pulse from its energy source - an encapsulated piece of a Moonlight artefact
Strelok's PDA
Strelok's PDA. A lot of people would like to get their hands on this. Contains a wealth of information - almost all of it heavily encrypted
AK-47
%c[255,255,128,128]\nBest regards from Syak!
Code combinations for the doors
Syak gave me the door code of a small shelter, located opposite the turning to Pripyat - 1287975
Information from the dead Monolithian

Found some mouldy documents and photos. Could make out 'laboratory' and 'Limansk' but the rest is impossible. There's a door code that looks like '886677', but nobody would be stupid enough to create a security code like that - would they?
Transition points

Formed when a 'Battery' reacts with a 'Snow' anomaly

Has the remarkable effect of rapidly healing open wounds, while detrimentally attracting small particles of metal in motion I.e. Bullets. The 'Ruby Pellicle' should partially nullify the effects of the 'Springboard' anomaly
 
Formed when a 'Pellicle' reacts with a 'Snow' anomaly

Lukash reported on the presence of a passage from the Freedom Base to the Dark Valley
Transition from Radar to the Army Warehouses
Transition given by the Guide from the Swamps to the Old Village
To the Army Warehouses
To Rostok
Unverified transition to Chernobyl

There are certain anomalies beyond current comprehension. One of these is the Jumper, which will instantly teleport matter a phenomenal distance away while the traveller experiences no discomfort nor awareness of moving through time and space. There's rumor of one at the Army Warehouses, that'll take you straight to the Monolithian base at the NPP...

Military Troop Commander
Cordon Defense
Report
14 Sept 2012 - at 2200 hours in the evening, roll call revealed the absence of three soldiers entrusted to my unit, located in the area of the former Agricultural Institute. Further investigation revealed that the missing soldiers were repeatedly insubordinate to their NCOs, and regularly absconded to visit the trader known as Sidorovich, who supplied them with cigarettes and alcohol.
According to their colleagues, they had discovered a hidden passage to the Cordon. The location and approach to this passage are detailed on the attached sketch map. The search for my missing soldiers is still ongoing
Guide: Near the vicinity of the former farm is an unregistered transition to Agroprom
In gratitude for bringing him an artefact for his experiments, the Scientist in the Bunker showed me a little known way from the Agroprom Research Institute to a research laboratory at Yantar

According to documents stolen from the military base at Agroprom, the Military planned to penetrate deep into the Zone through the newly-opened path, one section of which leads to Laboratory X-16, which is located close to the scientists' bunker at Yantar swamp
The Mercenary named Ara had a map of the secret route his group intend to take, from their base at the factory in the Wild Territory straight to the Army Warehouses

kull: The interrogation of a captured mercenary (now buried at the coordinates in the attached chart) revealed information on the existence of a hidden direct path, from the Army Warehouses to the main Mercenary base in the Wild Territory
Near the body of the zombified scientist in the Red Forest were the coordinates of a transition from the X-16 Research Facility, near the Yantar swamps, to the Radar antennae

Monolith, who zealously guarded the transition from Lab X-16, left behind a thick stack of documents which, amongst other scientific data, has a full description of the additional outlet in the Dark Valley

Decrypted data transmitted from Sidorovich to the Barkeep: The Military will soon make a huge breakthrough in the very heart of the Zone. They've discovered a transition from the Psi-emitter in Lab X-16 at Yantar, with possible direct access to the ghost town of Pripyat

During the raid of the X-18 lab, the Duty squad found a cabinet full of documents. Even with partial decoding, it's clear that the Military are preparing a massive incursion to the center of the zone. One key pathway is in the Dark Valley, which leads directly to Radar
Lukash, the leader of Freedom, revealed that they are actively using the passage from the Dark Valley right into their camp at the Army Warehouses
In gratitude for services rendered, Lukash gave me permission to use the secret passage to the Freedom camp from the Dark Valley
Transition points
Information is available from Mojito in regards to a transition originating at the Army Warehouses
The Barkeep has provided information about the location of a transition to Rostok
Scholar's Documents
Scholar's documents

'Playboy' is an American men's magazine that features high quality glossy photographs of nude women, as well as erotic and regular journalism and fiction. It was founded in Chicago in 1953 by Hugh Hefner and his colleagues, and funded in part by a $1,000 loan from Hefner's mother. The magazine has grown into Playboy Enterprises, Inc, with a presence in nearly every medium of communication. 'Playboy' is one of the world's best known brands and, depending on local decency laws, nation-specific versions of it are published worldwide
Unique BCC 'Vintorez'

Ammunition -
: 9x39mm SP-6 - armor
: 9x39mm SP-5 - sniper
Special 'Vintorez' sniper rifle. Optical (daytime) and electro-optical (night) sights enable accurate shooting at a distance, and an integrated suppressor ensures noise-free, flashless shots. A peculiarity of this unique weapon is the exceptionally low wear rate of the barrel. Rumor has it that this rifle has been enhanced by its placement inside an anomaly
Playboy Magazine

Since reaching its peak in the 1970s, Playboy has seen a decline in circulation and cultural relevance due to additional competition in the field it founded. Firstly from 'Penthouse', 'Oui' (published as a spin-off from Playboy) and 'Gallery' in the 1970s, then from increasingly explicit pornographic videos, more recently from 'lads' mags' such as Maxim and FHM, and finally the internet. In response, Playboy has attempted to reassert its hold on the 18-35 male demographic with slight changes to content, and focusing on issues and personalities more relevant to its target audience
'Playboy' collection (2006)

Flak jacket modified with the anti-gravity Cobblestone artefact. Allows the carrying of much heavier equipment in the field without losing mobility. Unfortunately, this modification makes the wearer more susceptible to harm, especially from explosive and impact damage. To make it more useful and valuable on long-range penetration missions, military engineers are looking for ways to nullify its negative qualities...
'Cobblestone' Armor
I need a better weapon. Are there any special jobs I can do to earn one?

One Stalker is in possession of a document I really need. I won't say who, nor from where, but it was quite near here that he fell into an anomaly. He survived, but the document was lost. I'd have gone looking for it myself, but I can't leave these Rookies alone. Find this document, bring it to me, and I'll give you an AK-74U as a reward. It's in the underpass under the railroad tracks, directly to the North.\nWill you do this for me?
Okay, if it's still there, in the underpass, I'll find it for you
Sorry Wolf, but I'm not going near any anomaly without protection...
Hey there Wolf, anything new happening?
Baby-sitting these Rookies, and drinking bad vodka. A typical day in the Zone!
Here, I found that document for you. I could really use that weapon you promised...
Yes! You're no Rookie now, are you?! Here you go - it's got a full mag...\nSee if you can talk with Kuznetsov. He should be able to help you with more cartridges
\nWolf asked me to find a lost document for him in the passageway under the railroad tracks. I should earn a decent AK-74u for this job...
A tough, heat-resistant document case
Military documents

Locked metal briefcase, requiring a code to unlock it electronically. According to the soldier hiding in the old trailer in the swamp, it contains data sent by the Base Commander about one of the excursions deep into the Zone
Documents from the Military Base
Bag of 'weed'
Moisture-proof bag filled with Afghan Kush marijuana
Max Lubero
Army radio
Army-issue VHF radio. An old, outdated model, but better than any other to resist most types of radiation throughout the Zone
Monitoring unit

Modern surveillance system that monitors the frequencies of regular Army VHF radios. This design allows remote monitoring, and in some cases may provide a more precise tuning of the teleports found throughout the Zone
Outpost documents
Documents found on the bodies on the path
Secret document
Documents containing orders and notes. What could possibly be of use in this jumbled old pile of papers?
File-folder containing documents
Orders of the Troop Commander from over the past six months
File-folder containing documents
Contains important information on the current methods of transforming artefacts
Documents plus unreadable disc
PDA containing important information
PDA found at the dump, in a Bandit camp. Among other useful information, it contains instructions on how to transmutate an artefact
Box of ammo
Heavy wooden box, containing boxes of cartridges
Metal box
Metal box containing a set of tools
Safe
Fireproof, armored safe locked with a magnetic key code. Inaccessible without a blowtorch! Contents: Unknown
Small box
Metal box
High Security Container
Steel laboratory container designed for storage and transportation of hazardous materials. Used in the Zone for transportation of artefacts with unknown properties
Book
Scientific book. Very difficult to understand
Notebook
Notebook filled with various scientific formulas and tables
Book
An unremarkable looking book with tattered pages sticking out at the edges
Diary
The Swamp Doctor's notebook. Judging from the last entry, he was here recently!
Doctor's Diary
There's a computer at the Pripyat bus station. Working or not, it still contains mapping information that can be used to operate the teleport
Computer
Laptop computer, found in Laboratory X-16. Contains detailed Seismological and Geological maps of Yantar, and surrounding areas
Scientist's PDA
Dead Pripyat scientist's PDA. Contains information that attracts 'mojito'
Diplomatic document case
Laptop computer found in Laboratory X-18. Surprisingly, still in working condition. Contains mapping data on the seismic survey conducted in the area around the Army Warehouses
Laptop computer with important data
Kruglov's device
Complex Electronic Measuring Converter
Mole's PDA
PDA which belonged to the Stalker nicknamed Mole
Max Lubero's PDA
Max Lubero says that this PDA contains many secrets regarding the Duty faction
Wolfhound's PDA
Amongst the encrypted data is a description concerning the transmutation of artefacts
Ara's PDA
A Mercenary named Ara kept many secrets concerning his group, including a description of the secret passage between the Army Warehouses and the Wild Territory
Monolith PDA (unknown)
Found a PDA near the Psi-emitter. Amongst all the gibberish was an artefact transmutation recipe
Fireproof steel case with a combination lock\nContents: Cash
Steel security case
\nThe Stalker named Guide asked me to find him a good combat rifle. An OTs-14 'Thunderstorm' should do the trick...
\nProfessor Sakharov, from the mobile lab in the Yantar wetland, has asked me to find him a rare artefact, an Elder Beads. In return, he'll show me a hidden pathway...
\nProfessor Sakharov said that the Military has stolen a metal case of documents relating to the study of pathways throughout the Zone

\nGeneral Voronin urgently needs to recover a metal case of important documents, which inadvertently got left in a building in the Dark Valley. Exactly what these documents pertain to, he's not saying...

A leader within Freedom says that they need some dynamite. Maybe this'll help pave the way into the Dark Valley. According to Lukash, there should be some dynamite in the Rookie camp. Exactly where, I've no idea...
\nInside the box taken from the Military base at Agroprom was a disk containing encrypted data. I'm told that the Barkeep in the old factory at Rostok can decipher it
\nTolik asked me to bring him five blind dog's tails. He needs them to convert an artefact
Did you want to ask me something?

I met a seasoned Stalker recently. We shared a bottle, and he taught me how to make a Meat Chunk by combining two other artefacts plus some blind dog's tails. I was trying to get them myself but, as you can see, I barely survived. If you can bring me these tails, I'll share the secret with you, and we can make them together
Okay, I'll try to get those tails for you
I'm sorry, but I can't help you
I brought you those tails you asked for
Wow! Marked One, I can't thank you enough!
Please take them. They stink!
Wait here. I wrote down how to use these to make a Meat Chunk. Though I've not been able to test it yet, so cross your fingers...
How can I can help you?

We control this part of the Cordon, protecting it against Bandits and other nasties - occasionally we can give you useful information - but as you can see, our weapons are quite archaic. We're not short of ammunition - Sid sees to that - but if you can get me TOZ-34 hunting rifle, it'll be much more effective for this terrain. In return, I'll tell you how to transform a cheap artefact into a decent one
Sure, no problem. Shouldn't be difficult. I think Sidorovich has one in stock
Thank you. I hope you can help me out
Hey there! I brought you the TOZ
You came just at the right time. The Bandits are causing trouble again...
Do you need my help?

Thanks, but they're gone for now. Wait, I promised to tell you how to make Slugs, so here: Get a Medusa, a Quirk, a Blind dog's tail and a 300 gram sausage. Don't laugh, I'm serious! Drop it all into a Vortex anomaly, and wait. After ten minutes you'll have a Slug artefact. Really!
\nPetruha, team leader, requests you to bring him a TOZ-34 hunting rifle, to help him protect the area from mutants
Do you have any info on artefact modification?

Yesterday one of the local Bandits, after a strong drink, started boasting that he'd soon be rich. Claimed that he could convert a Medusa into a better artefact. Let's try it out! You find a Medusa, bring it to me, and I'll share his recipe with you. Deal?
Sounds interesting enough. Let's give it a try
Sounds like bullshit to me...
I found a Medusa for you
Okay, let's try out this transmutation recipe of yours
Here you go. So, how's it done?

The Bandit said to toss a Medusa, a Stone Blood, an ordinary bandage, and a can of food into a Whirligig anomaly, then leave it for about ten minutes. I'm not sure what's supposed to happen after that, but we'll soon find out!
\nNimble wants to try out a new transmutation that he learned from a Bandit. To do this, he needs a Medusa artefact
\nNimble wants to try out a new transmutation that he learned from a Bandit. To do this, he needs a Medusa artefact
Hello, Major. Do you need any errands run?

Well, you're a cheeky one, but who dares wins, eh? As it happens there is something. It'll be my birthday soon, so listen up! We've plenty of food, but not enough booze. Unfortunately, I can't just go to a corner shop and buy some around here... So, if you were to bring me, let's say, ten bottles of vodka, I will give you three boxes of ammunition, plus some useful information. We recently detained a Stalker who swore that he could create a Crystal Thorn. I'll tell you when you bring the vodka, okay? This'll be one piece of business you'll not regret!
Thank you. I'll organise it for you...
Not interested. Sorry...
Good morning Major, and a happy birthday to you!
Fuck that, Stalker! Did you bring the vodka?
Yep, ten bottles as requested. The real deal, too...

Well done Stalker! I remembered your reward - three boxes of ammo. Oh, and the recipe. Let me put that in your PDA.\nIf you need any gear from me in future, don't forget to bring vodka!\nThere's another little matter I'd like to discuss with you, but it can wait until later...

\nMajor Kuznetsov can supply rounds for an AK-74, plus useful information on artefact transformation, in exchange for ten bottles of vodka. He also promised further bargains to be had upon the successful execution of a personal favour
What kind of medkit do you need?

I'm not sure. The blind dogs around here seem to getting even more mutated, so even the tiniest cut could mean the difference between life and death! You have to cut out the piece of contaminated flesh completely, and disinfect it immediately.\nIf you're up to it, bring me a dozen medkits. I'll give you another artefact recipe, okay?
Okay, I'll get them for you\nAh, the Zone! It's like shit - the deeper you're in, the worse it gets!
Sorry Fox, but I need to move on. You're on your own...
Hi Fox. I've got the ten medkits you wanted
Excellent. You brought me Army medkits? Right?
No, the standard ones. You didn't say anything about Army kits...

Sorry, my mistake. They'll do. Here's your recipe, as I promised. Find an Electro anomaly, and throw in a Stone Blood, a Medusa, a dog's tail, and a bottle of vodka. After about ten minutes you'll get a Fireball!
Fox needs at least ten medkits
How are you feeling now?

Much better, thanks to you, and I'd like to return the favor. A craftsman recently converted a small MP5 submachine gun to use a heavier cartridge. With one of these, it'd be easier for me to fight the Bandits here. I know that a Stalker carrying this very weapon perished in the railway tunnel leading from the Garbage to Agroprom. If you can find it for me you can keep whatever else he had, and I'll share information I have on converting an artefact...
In the tunnel you say? Okay, I'll take a look
We'll see. I'm not making any promises
Guess where I've been...
Did you find the gun?
Found it, tested it. Not bad at all. Here you go...
With such a weapon I can defend myself properly. Thank you!! Now, let's add some recipes to your PDA...\nPsst. Listen, Marked One... Can I ask you something?
\nYurek, a Novice from the Garbage, has asked me to find him a modified MP-5 M1 machine gun
What a day! Okay, what do you need?

I just arrived yesterday from the Cordon, I don't know how...\nI wanted to prove to everyone at the rookie camp that I'm worthy, but as soon as I'd left there I was mugged by Bandits. If I return now, they'll all laugh at me. If I could just get part of a mutant - you know, something like a Burer - then I could hold my head high when I go back. If you have one spare, I'll tell you about a special artefact...
A Burer? You sure you don't want something easier? Like a Bloodsucker or a Chimera? Okay, I'll see what I can do for you...
Alas, poor Yurek, but this is something you have to do for yourself...
Hi Yurek. Do you still want a Burer's hand?
Oh, yes! Please! Do you have one?
Here, catch. Now you can say you caught it!

Now, when I'm in the camp, I'll walk proudly, full of stories. About you, of course!\nAnyway, regarding this artefact, I overheard a conversation between the Bandits. Not far from here, in the Forgotten Forest, is a very special artefact, an Emerald Medusa. It's next to some big stones, near a den of wild dogs. As if that wasn't enough, some Chimeras have moved into the area, too. Which is why it'll probably still be there. Nobody wants to get within sniffing distance of the area...
\nYurek, a rookie from the Garbage, wants me to bring him a Burer's paw
Interested in conducting business?

Maybe you can do a favour for me and my group?
Old Stalkers - you know, the ones still alive - they know that a gulp of vodka increases your resistance to radiation and anomalies. They also know that one gulp leads to the whole bottle!
There are eight of us here, so if you bring me eight bottles of vodka, and eight boar hooves, I'll give you a very useful and expensive artefact
Do you agree?
I'm happy to help, as long you're not just using me to get drunk...

Pseudodogs are a bastard up close, but I can take them out at a distance for you...

Here are your Pseudodog tails, and I believe you have an artefact for me?

alls agree ?!! Do you have to hold cops ?!

When we examined the scene where the helicopter crash in the Forgotten Forest, I saw there was an interesting artefact, but to take it did not work, the military arrived. Since then, I dreamt that damned green stuff.
Can you bring? there are other rare ones that might interest you as well...
I'll go and check it out for you

There is one option.\nWhen we last tried to get into the X-16, I thought I saw an unusual artefact. We then fought off the Zombies right at the exit from the factory. There at the far wall, right, as viewed from the entrance, is a green construction trailer and inside it was something. At this time the controller has brought us to pass the buck and had to move very quickly.\nCan you bring? I have a new model of anomaly detector, which can determine the type of anomalies
I need to visit Yantar anyway... Sure

\nKruglov saw an unusual artefact in the factory Yantar (from the entrance to the factory, right to the end, in the construction trailer). If you bring this artefact, he promises to give you the new anomaly detector

We sent for slaughter, so I rest awhile. To return to the mainland and to prove it, I need an order, which we then gave. To my knowledge, all the orders were stored in a metal safe. The captain kept it on the second floor of the complex. If you got hold of this folder with the orders, then I can quietly dissapear. As a thanks I can offer a very rare artefact, Ruby Battery. Well?
Anything to get you out of here... eh?.
No man, Agroprom is too hot for me
Hi, soldier. I have some news for you...
What? Not bad, I hope?
Don't worry, I found the order for your arrest. It's yours now...
I will appreciate this until my dying day.\nMy gift to you, I hope, will be useful.\nBut I doubt we'll meet again. Farewell, my friend...

\nThe deserter needs me to get the wrongful order for his arrest from his superiors. According to him, the folder with these orders are kept in a metal safe, on the second floor of the main agricultural building
What's wrong? Can I help with anything?

A couple of days ago, sitting in the railway tunnel opposite the entrance to the plant, I received an SOS from the local guys and went to their rescue, but in the confusion I dropped my PDA. Then the soldiers arrived. I've been waiting here for days for a chance to look for it, but now I need to make myself scarce. It'll be somewhere between the tunnel and the entrance here. It may even still be in the tunnel, but watch out there - it's full of anomalies...
If I find it, I'll let you know
Anomalies? No, I have my own paths to follow
I found your PDA
Not damaged?
I didn't check. Here...
Unbelievable, the battery's not even flat. Look, please accept this recipe for making a Slime artefact, with my gratitude...
\nMole needs me to find his PDA, which he thinks he dropped in a railway tunnel outside the entrance to Agroprom
Hi Wolf! What are you doing here ?

Hi Marked One. So, look for business from here, in the case of breaking the barrier should cause reinforcements from the bar. Tolik, became faint and fell somewhere with the radio, this radio is crucial for monitoring the military. Can you learn about Tolik? I'll let you in on a big secret, how you can eliminate the anomalies, if they are in the way
Perhaps even a Mincer? Okay I'll find this poor guy
I think Tolik will soon be dead
Hello Wolf, I found Tolik
What's wrong with him? Where's the radio transceiver?
Here it is. Tolik dropped it when a shitload of Bloodsuckers attacked him as an emission started. I don't blame the guy, I'd probably have done the same...
Ha, that I overcame, emissions often go.\nSo, about anomalies: I only know as electricity discharge, be it Ruby Battery roll.\nMaybe with other anomalies can be so do you need to look for ways?
Tolik! What are you doing here? Wolf's been waiting at the Warehouses for you and the radio!

I'm sorry I've caused so much trouble. I was on my way to Wolf when an emission started. I was just figuring out the best place to shelter, while carrying the radio, when I was attacked by four Bloodsuckers! I took out three, but I ran out of ammunition and my knife broke. I've no idea how I got out alive, but I must have dropped the radio when I ran...
Okay, where's the transceiver now?

With any luck it'll still be at the Dump, near the hangar. Close to those trench pipes... It's the course I was taking so I wouldn't be seen, away from the main paths, so it's unlikely anyone will have come across it unless they knew it was there. I'd get it myself, but I'm still shaking. I'm really sorry...

Wolf is trying to monitor the military, and ideally needs a proper army radio transceiver. Tolik was supposed to bring him one, but has not been in touch. I need to find out what happened to it, and deliver it to Wolf
Wow! The guys at the Barrier need ammunition as if they felt every shot fired...

Heh. And the ammunition is in trouble. End They have mainly NATO weapons, but here in the warehouses only to the Kalash Zinc. Sid has promised to send the box, the other, but you need to find him a courier. I promised him a new artefact, let the pen, and cartridges. Can hit the road? But not for just. Here to me from all sides flocking information, there are some unusual recipies available
You don't need to pay me for doing the right thing. I'll go...
No, I'm not going
A box of cartridges. I was told you needed them urgently...
Yes, we do! What calibre?
The case says 5.56, but I've not checked inside...
Yes, that's what we need. Give me your PDA - I promised you the recipe for the Slime artefact. If you're interested, I have other recipes you can earn, too...
Hello, Sid. Do you really spend all day down here drinking booze?
What can I say? I have worms. Now tell me what you want or fuck off...
Miser sent you a rare artefact. It's in a sealed case, so I can't tell you what kind. He wants to swap it for NATO ammunition, whatever you can spare...
Yes, he contacted by radio. Keep the case, I have enough of them...
\nCartridges at the end of the block office near the Barrier. Sidorovich asked Miser to exchange a rare artefact for a box of cartridges
You said you have more Recipes?

Yes. I've a little business for you. I've heard that a group of young military researchers were working with Cobblestone artefacts, trying to use their anti-gravity properties in a suit to carry loads of stuff. But they were lured to America and didn't finish their work. Apparently two prototype suits still exist, and as usual with the military, they've likely been thrown into an attic and forgotten. Care to find them for me, so we can put them to good use?
Interesting, be sure to see, what it is
contact with the military reluctant to
I found these suits, awsome things!
And what properties?
They allow the wearer to carry an extra 170 kg. But they're heavy, and they have many negative side effects...
Okay! Thank you, leave yourself alone, can be useful. I've sent you a Recipe...

\nMiser drew me a diagram of how to locate the experimental anti-gravity Cobblestone suits at the Cordon's Military base. He also advised that their unstable anomalous properties gave them a tendency to pass through solid surfaces while in storage, a problem the boffins hadn't resolved, and which made them, er, unsuitable for active deployment...
Do you have any artefact mods?

Yes, if you're prepared to do something for me. We have a lot of brave guys here, who often risk their lives to protect what we have. Sometimes they need to relax, and when vodka doesn't do it they end up fighting each other. There's a type of hemp that grows around the lake in Agroprom which has mutated into the most powerful weed you've ever smoked. You can see the auras of everything around you. Well, there's a poor bastard there who's been collecting it. He's got nothing but rats to eat and swamp water to drink, so he's happy to exchange some of it for proper food. Take him twenty cans, bread and sausages, plus five bottles of vodka. Say it's from me and he'll give you a bag of high quality grass...
Sure, I'll help him out...
Hey, I'm not a drug mule...
I have that special bag you asked for...
Wonderful! Would you like to try some?
Thanks for the offer, but I need to stay alert...
No problem. Here's the artefact mod I promised you...

Freedom's trader wants to try out unique herbal 'remedy' that a deserter has collected from around the Agroprom lake. In return for a bag of the stuff he wants 20 twenty cans of food, 20 loaves, 20 sausages, and 5 bottles of vodka. Naturally, I need to supply all this myself, but Miser has promised me a useful artefact modification...
Hi, good to see you again. You okay here? I heard you had a bag of exotic flora for sale...
Wow, word got around fast!
Don't worry, you're safe. Miser sent me. He asked me to bring you some food...
Oh, thank goodness! I never know each day if I'm going to be caught and shot. This stuff has kept me sane. I keep it just outside though, as the smell is quite heady, if you know I mean...
Who else can I help out?

You know Bes, the commander of the Loners at the dump? His unit has run out of ammunition, but I've got a load of stuff off the bandits, including a box of ammunition. Would you take it to Bes for me? But you'll need to find him, and it's a heavy box...
No problem. I'll find him...
I'm sorry, but I've no idea where to start looking for him...
Hi Bes. Bullet sent these cartridges for you...
Just in time! The Bandits are already showing their stupid faces...
Keep the box...
Thanks for your help. Hey, here's an artefact conversion recipe for you...
Bullet has sent ammunition to Bes, the commander of the Loner detachment at the Garbage
My friend, can you help me find my PDA?
Where did you last see it?

I was being held captive in the Agroprom underground. Just before they caught me I hid my PDA. I thought I was a dead man, but that PDA has information that shouldn't fall into hands of bandits. I left it on the stairs, near a hole in the wall to an access tunnel full of electrical anomalies. If you manage to find it it for me I promise you a conversion recipe to make a Soul...
I'm happy to help. I'll be in touch...
Sorry, but there's no way I'm going down there...
Hey, I found your PDA
Wow! You're the man!
Here you go...
my gratitude has no limits! Give communication code, Salt will you a way to convert.\nCan you even one little crank?

found means. Complications?

debt in debt will remain. Let's code of communication, a way to convert salt you

I received a new recipe, which I've not been able to test. You should be able to get a Moonlight from a ordinary Flash, but I don't have a Flash. Try to get me one, and I'll share the recipe with you...
But these Flashes are like dirt, you got it

found Means. Quick as diarrhea!

\nPetrenko needs a Flash artefact
Hi. Do you fix weapons and armor here?

Well, I've got the skills, but unfortunately no tools. Sidorovich has put a kit together for me, but I've not been able to get to him. He needs a rare artefact that I found for him here. Are you able to make the journey for me? In return I'll show you how to convert a Flash artefact into a Soul...
Sure. I'm going that way...
Not at the moment. I have business with the Monolith...
Hi, Syak. Sid sends his greetings, and your tools...

Excellent, now I can set up shop here. I have a gift for you. Would you honour me in being my first customer to be fitted for an exclusive suit? Well, when I say 'exclusive', it means I only have one, but I'd be happy to give it to you...
I'd be honored. Here's your box...

Wow, it's heavy! Wonderful! Oh, and here's a useful tip for you - If you ever need a shelter, or hide anything, between here and X-10, there's a locked equipment room at the furthermost west point of the long fence that borders the Red Forest, close to the turn to Pripyat. You need to climb a ladder to get to it, but the entry code is 1287975...
\nSyak, a trader from the Radar, can carry out repairs, but needs you to bring him a box of the necessary tools from Sidorovich
Do you have any useful artefact recipes or mods?

I believe there's a way to convert a few cheap artefacts into a Goldfish, but I've not tried it. If you can find me a proper Goldfish for comparison, we'll try it. And if it works, I'll share the Recipe with you. Okay?
Fair enough. I'll find a Goldfish for you...
Thanks, but I've no need for it...
I have a Goldfish for you...
Well done! Shall we try it?
Sure, take it...
Okay, I've sent the Recipe to your PDA...
\nSyak, the trader from Radar, wants me to bring him a Goldfish artefact
Do you have any useful artefact recipes or mods?

Did you know you can convert a Goldfish to a Glassbeads? It's one of the best mods I know! But I'd like a favour from you, please. I've heard that a group of scientists abandoned a small safe in Laboratory X-18. There's something inside I need. Can you get it for me?
Glassbeads are very flexible artefacts. Okay, I'll find this safe for you
Thanks, but I've no need for a Glassbeads...
Here's your safe from X-18... It weighs a ton...
Surely you exaggerate. It can't be more than 20 kilos...
I wish I could have got the damn thing open, and saved the weight...
What are you, my quartermaster? This is not your concern! Now, here's your recipe...
\nSyak, the trader at Radar, has asked me to bring him a small safe from Lab X-18
Do you have any useful artefact recipes or mods?

The only other one I know is how to convert a Night Star into a Battery. If you're interested, I have a simple job for you. I talked with Miser on the radio. He has a new model of armor, but something doesn't work. I need it for research, so I can repair it. Would you take some money to him in exchange for the faulty suit?
A new model? Sounds interesting. I'll do it...
Thanks, but Batteries are easy to find...
I brought your armor...
Let's see it...
Here you go...
Ah, yes. I see what's wrong. Let me get your Recipe...
\nSyak, the trader at Radar, asked me to exchange money with Miser for a new model of armor
Hi, Sid. How are you doing?
Marked One. What an unexpected surprise! What do you need?
Syak sent me with a rare artefact for you. He needs tools. Said that you'd know which ones...
Yes, he contacted me by radio. Here's the box I prepared for him, but be careful not to drop it...
Hi Miser. You look like crap...
Yeah, we smoked the lot...
Syak sent me to collect some armor from you...
Yes, he contacted me by radio. Here it is, SEVA-10, but the waste system leaks. No one takes you seriously if they think you've shit yourself...
Hi, I've got a special artefact for you...
Oh? What kind of artefact?
From Kruglov. He said you know about it...
Ah, yes. Here's his money. Another scientist trying to rob me, just like like everyone else!
Good evening, Professor. I'm here for Petrenko...
Ah, an unusual artefact?
Petrenko said there was still such
Yes, judging by the description, nonsense! I promised him a new Exoskeleton for his brother, take it
Don't smart people say that information is the best investment?
Can you tell me the way to Freedom's base?
I've heard there's a way to get straight into the Sarcophagus. Is this true?

Well, there is such information, but it's not cheap. Have you heard of a Jumper anomaly? Well, there's one not too far from here that'll take you straight to Chernobyl. Not into the Sarcophagus as such, but very close...
How much?
held in the Radar at the Army Warehouses, and could not get back. Would you know how to get it back?
Most certainly. For the right price...
Forget it. I'll find it myself...
How much?
100,000 roubles for this information. Are you interested?
For this valuable information, 150,000 roubles. Are you interested?

At the moment this is exclusive information. The more people buy it, the cheaper it gets until it becomes common knowledge. That's how it works. It all depends on who wants to be first. If it's you, the price is 400,000 roubles
No, leave it. I'll manage somehow...
Yes, please...
That's a lot of money. You'd better not be shitting me...
I think you made the right choice...
I hope so...
What are you looking for?
Do you have any cheap Recipes for transforming artefacts?
No, thanks...
Yes, I do. 30,000 roubles. Agreed?
Agreed...
Thanks, but not enough money at the moment...
Do you have any other Recipes for transforming artefacts?
I've a Recipe for making a Dummy if you're interested, but it's 50,000 roubles. Agreed?
Agreed...
There you go. I've uploaded the data to your PDA
Excellent
Greetings, Kruglov
Marked One, when you were in the laboratory, did you come across a portable digital recorder?
What kind of recorder?
We gave Ghost a new type of decoder to analyse and plot the varying frequencies and amplitudes of the Psi-emissions...
No, I didn't see it, but I wasn't looking for it...

Okay, it's a small, handheld box with illuminated digits. We think that Ghost was in the main control room taking measurements before things went bad down there. You know the area now. If you'd be good enough to find it for us, it'll go a long way towards helping us understand the nature of the Psi-emissions, and I'll personally give you a recipe for transforming a Gravi into a Goldfish...
Okay, I'll see what I can do
Sorry, but that place is full of extremely creepy shit...
Is this what you're looking for?
Yes! That's it!
Here. It's yours...
Thank you so much, on behalf of our entire scientific community. Here's the Recipe I promised. Tell me something - are you planning to see Sidorovich anytime soon?
\nKruglov is looking for a lost decoder. He says it should be in or near the main control panel inside the X-16 laboratory...
Why?

Look, please keep this between us, but we receive a very basic salary here. We love our work, so the government expects us to work for nothing. Sakharov certainly would! Well, recently I found an unusual artefact, so I contacted Sidorovich. He's agreed to pay me once he sees the artefact, and he sent me one of his special artefact containers, but I'm not allowed to leave here. You have the reputation of being a man of honour, and if you're seeing Sidorovich anyway, would you mind acting as a courier for me? I can't afford to offer you any money, but I could give you a very special artefact Recipe...
Okay, to further the advancement of science...
Yes, I could afford to stay here longer...
Hello
Well? All right?
Normally, keep your money
Thank you, if that be, always just ask. Added recipe
\nKruglov needs to make some money. Sent a unique artefact to Sidorovich, requests to bring payment
What is required?

Some time after the second release, several groups of scientists continued to work in secret laboratories. Their observations and conclusions would very much help in the process of cognition of the anomalous Zone. If you can, try to check the laboratory X-18, X-16 and a laboratory in the Radar. Judging from the fragmentary information that survived, several notebooks and manuscripts still exist. For a fee not to worry, there is a recipe for artefact Pellicle, it will be yours
And share the findings? Well
Sorry, I can not do this
Hello, Professor
What? Is that it?
Yes, this is the book and a couple of manuscripts
So, we must carefully examine. The recipe you have earned, this is exactly. Load the memory.\nYes, there is much necessary information. Describes how to use the teleport. Nothing, a

According to preliminary data in the X-18 book, should be in a room with a refrigerator. The X-16 book may be in the room where I linked to Ghost the last time out. The laboratory notebook in the Radar may be near the main control panel
What is required?
Sakharov has two Exoskeletons, I arranged with him to exchange the pair for a rare artefact. You work by courier? I'll share a recipe with you
These recipes are killing me... Okay, I'll be your mule...
Find another
you, I absolutely welcome
Op-PA, our runner. How it hangin?
fetched, so they both
Well thanks to the debt you have, you'll be presented at the Encouragements. Get your PDA, write a prescription
\nIn exchange for two Exoskeletons from Sakharov, Petrenko will give you a rare artefact
I'm listening
alone will remain between us? Can you pass one thing to Miser?
Sure, why not.
Find another
I brought you something...
Keep your voice down... Now, what were you saying?
Here's your money...
Okay. Take out your PDA, and write down this Recipe...
Greetings, soldier...
Hey, Marked One, I've been meaning to ask a favour of you...
Sure. How can I help?

Don't worry, there's nothing dangerous involved, but I can tell you how to find a unique Vintorez if you'll find me a magazine. Not that type of magazine, but an old Playboy. My aunt had a recipe published in it, and I was showing everyone around the Bar. Then I had too much vodka and crashed out. When I woke up someone had pinched my magazine. Would you ask around a bit? Maybe even look around, if you know what I mean... I don't remember the issue, but on the cover there are three charming brunettes in a kitchen...
No problem. I'll have a look around for you...
No offence, but this isn't really my line of work...
Hey, I brought you something...
Oh, yes?
Are these your three brunettes?

Yes, they are! Gorgeous aren't they? Oh, and look, here's my aunt's recipe! Okay, at the commanders' base in Agroprom is a safe, in which he keeps all his special stuff. In there should be the Vintorez. It's yours...

\nIvantsov needs a Playboy magazine containing his aunt's favourite kitchen recipe. In return, he'll tell me where to find a unique VCC Vintorez. He doesn't know the date of the magazine, but I'm to recognize it by the three engaging brunettes on the cover...
I've brought something for you...
What have you got?
Captain Ivantsov says hello, and asks if you have something for him...
Ha! He and I go back a long way. That guy is really something, though. Like everyone's favourite aunt...
Hello Marked One. Come, let's talk
Hi Marked One, heard a lot of flattering things about you. Want to know a way to convert an artefact?
Well, Marked One, what have you brought?
Well there is something I can do?
In the process
Later on I will give

Can you repair armor?
Let's see, ta-aak, can do it, but need the money. Have you?
Yes, here it is, repair
Blinn, I am stranded
Well, the mind can not be said that the new, but all the protective functions are working properly

.
The 'Meat Chunk' artefact can be produced in a Springboard anomaly with just four ingredients:
Quirk
Stone Blood
Vodka
Dog tail
Transformation should occur within 5-10 minutes Zone Time

.

At the Sarcophagus I hid, and watched the Monolithians bow, in turn, to their sacred Monolith, and make an offering before it, whereupon there'd be a blinding white flash and a teleport would magically appear in the same place for each of them. They'd pass through it and it would disappear each time, to reappear for the next one who made a similar offering. I had to find out more, though it took a long time to get close enough do so
I observed that each of them offered a Goldfish artefact, which they placed carefully in front of the Monolith, to make the teleport appear. So I tried it myself. I returned with a Goldfish, faced the 'Monolith', and dropped it in as I would into an anomaly. Sure enough, a teleport appeared close by as before, and I entered it. I'm grateful to say that it worked, and that I found myself, as yet unharmed, in a hangar at Chernobyl NPP1...
